title: 2 Quick Ways to Turn On YouTube Subtitles or Closed Captions

steps.title: Open the YouTube app.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app. The YouTube icon looks like a white play button in a red rectangle. Not all videos have subtitles (captions) available. You'll only see subtitles if the uploader manually added them or if YouTube automatically generates them.

steps.title: Navigate to a video.
steps.content: Navigate to a video. You can tap the magnifying glass icon to search for a specific video or browse your home feed.

steps.title: Tap the video.
steps.content: Tap the video. This will bring up the player controls.

steps.title: Tap the cog icon.
steps.content: Tap the cog icon. This is in the top-right corner. Alternatively, you can tap CC to quickly toggle captions on.

steps.title: Tap Captions.
steps.content: Tap Captions . This is below Playback speed .

steps.title: Tap a subtitle option.
steps.content: Tap a subtitle option. If the uploader has added multiple languages, you'll see them listed here. If the uploader did not upload their own subtitles/captions, you'll see (auto-generated) next to it. If the video's audio is in a different language, you may see Auto-translate . Tap it to allow YouTube to automatically translate the audio. Keep in mind it may not be completely accurate. Your video will continue with subtitles on.

steps.title: View the transcript (optional).
steps.content: View the transcript (optional). If the creator uploaded a transcript of a video, you can find it in the video description. Do the following: Navigate to a YouTube video. Expand the description section. Tap Show transcript at the very bottom.

steps.title: Go to https://www.youtube.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.youtube.com/ in a web browser. You can use any browser. Not all videos have subtitles (captions) available. You'll only see subtitles if the uploader manually added them or if YouTube automatically generates them. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Navigate to a video.
steps.content: Navigate to a video. You can use the search bar at the top to search for a specific video or browse your home feed.

steps.title: Hover over the video.
steps.content: Hover over the video. This will open the player controls.

steps.title: Click the cog icon.
steps.content: Click the cog icon. This is at the bottom-right corner of the video. Alternatively, you can click CC to quickly toggle captions on.

steps.title: Click Subtitles/CC.
steps.content: Click Subtitles/CC . You can find this in the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click a subtitle option.
steps.content: Click a subtitle option. If the uploader has added multiple languages, you'll see them listed here. If the uploader did not upload their own subtitles/captions, you'll see (auto-generated) next to it. If the video's audio is in a different language, you may see Auto-translate . Click it to allow YouTube to automatically translate the audio. Keep in mind it may not be completely accurate. Optionally, you can click Options on the top-right of the "Subtitles/CC" pop-up, and change your subtitle font, color, size and format.

steps.title: View the transcript (optional).
steps.content: View the transcript (optional). If the creator uploaded a transcript of a video, you can find it in the video description. Do the following: Navigate to a YouTube video. Click ...more to expand the description section. Click Show transcript at the very bottom.
